The "orthodox" Caliph 'AII ibn Ahr Talib (r. 35/656-40/661) appointed al-A!'ari as his personal representative, while Mu'awiyah, then governor of a province and 'Ali's challenger (r. 41/661-60/680), matched al-M'ari with 'Amr ibn al-'A$. The two arbiters (t,akamayn) met and held a public session in Rajah, 38/January, 659, at Adrub, on the main caravan route between Medina and Damascus.
